feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 18 at 2:00AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY... WHAT...Surfs of 9 to 12 feet WHERE...East and south shores WHEN...Through Friday IMPACTS...Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making water recreation difficult and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued September 18 at 2:00AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY... * Breezy trades of 25 to 30 mph with higher gusts will impact all islands of American Samoa tonight through at least Tuesday... * TIMING...tonight through Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Expect possible downed tree limbs as well as shifting of loose and unsecured small objects due to strong winds. Gusty
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 11:20AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN WAYNE...SOUTHEASTERN MONROE AND NORTH CENTRAL ONTARIO COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... entry.cap:areaDesc: Monroe; Ontario; Wayne

entry.summary: ...WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS TODAY... .A dry cold front will sweep through the region today, resulting in breezy to windy conditions during the afternoon and evening hours.
